Bottom line: I think this is a love it or hate it place. Coffee is a bit pricey, while food is reasonable. Its a pretty place, and is certainly worth at least one visit. The mac-n-cheese sandwich is must try, if not for its taste then simply for the originality.", 'date': '2011-06-01 15:08:35', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 588, 'average_stars': 3.6, 'yelping_since': '2009-03-05 16:03:31'}}
[R5] {'review_id': 'eVVQP6FQLYu44y4NPlHPuQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'y8aWXOimQ9ZgUgZ6q--nCQ', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': 'I stopped in 1 Shot yesterday when I was down at Liberties Walk and desperate for some caffeine and a snack. The woman behind the counter didn't acknowledge me until I had been standing there patiently for at least 5 minutes. She then took my order and continued to make the other customer's bagel...which turned out to be not what she had ordered. The customer was annoyed, I was about to pass out and the employee didn't really seem concerned, but at that point she asked me if I wanted the bagel for free since she would just have to throw it out. I thought that was very nice, and from there she proceeded to make my latte, which was not great but not offensive, either. Once she registered that I was there I felt like the service was good but it got off to a rocky start...I was actually standing in line crafting my Yelp review as I waited and then mentally revised it when she treated me a little better.

All in all, this seems like a decent place to go if you're on Liberties Walk and gotta have a cup of coffee, but I'm not sure if I'd go out of my way to grab a bite there. That's too bad, because the shop itself is so cute and there were some interesting people hanging out. Maybe if I'm back over that way I'll stop in again and give it "1" more "shot"  (sorry- bad pun but I couldn't resist!).', 'date': '2008-01-19 19:02:20', 'useful': 5, 'funny': 4, 'cool': 5, 'user': {'review_count': 472, 'average_stars': 3.93, 'yelping_since': '2007-11-07 15:25:43'}}
[R6] {'review_id': '2iQ4e11Aw34gR_Grf6u4Cw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'jzMPqVNvZRdS47Iydiomrg', 'stars': 2.0, 'text': 'I walked in from a chilly morning to have it get chilled even further by a blasé staff.
I typically just come in to buy coffee in bulk, and now I'm remembering why I'd rather just order it online (or SHOT TOWER!) and brew it myself in the comfort of my own home. 
I walked in at 10am, got the briefing on some specials by one barista, quickly reviewed the menu to see if there's anything new, and casually made my way to the register to order.
I attempted to order the early special (8am-10am, bagel and a 12oz. coffee), but it was 10:04, and the staff just sorta gave me a *sighing, couldn't believe I'd ask* look (the same look was rehearsed a second time when my companion asked for the internet password).
I guess for all technicality's sake, I shouldn't get the early morning special that ends at 10am at 10:04, but when I've been lingering and making small talk with the staff for 4 minutes, I figured some air of humanity would prevail...Instead, I ended up with an antiseptic answer I'd expect from a automated calling system...Needless to say, I didn't get the special. 
I get it, I'm ordering after 10am. Maybe the system you use to complete transactions wouldn't allow you to process the request - but I find that hard to believe, and harder to believe there isn't a way around that if it was the case...Its not like the kitchen's packed and cleaned up the bagels, or the coffee at 10:01. Its just not the kind of service I would've predicted from such an otherwise solid establishment - especially when other, closer-to-home coffee shop options are available - doesn't competition drive some sense of flexibility or courtesy to the customer - its Monday morning for all of us, right? $4 for a bagel and 12oz. of coffee is still delivering a substantial profit no matter what time of day you're ordering it. 
I ended up ordering a tofu breakfast burrito (I'm vegan, it was admittedly good), and the coffee is always good (kinda hard to "F" up Stumptown brews anyway), but after that experience, my order stopped there. The primary point I'm trying to make here is that I would've ordered more food which would've also included following through on my whole whimsical inspiration to go there in the first place - to order a special coffee, or dirty chai etc. - something I can't or don't feel like making at home - which would've consequently resulted in me handing over more money (the price tags were already at the higher end for what I think is reasonable), and more tips (I still tipped - I'm not that shallow) to the establishment as a whole.
And, last but not least - left with a 'pleasant taste' of the place in general instead of the nagging desire to write this - my first  - Yelp! review. 
I kick myself now for not at least using their wifi to do so. 
While I'm at it...I may as well also make a quick stab about the music - good choices, in fact, the ambience of this place is pretty much flawless -  but if you're going to play it off your iPhone, put that shit in Airplane mode so I don't have to hear it pause and beep through the speakers every time you get a new notification.', 'date': '2012-02-13 19:24:24', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 1, 'user': {'review_count': 2, 'average_stars': 3.0, 'yelping_since': '2010-11-26 15:45:41'}}
[R7] {'review_id': 'MczN3OBeL-3xVRyxoysLcA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'Jsv94uvmVEcyshiGhP2uuw', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': '"You've only got one shot, so make it count."

One Shot is all you need.

I first heard about One Shot Coffee from an old friend and immediately put it on my Philly bucket list when she told me about the blueberry apple pie chai she had. I mean, how many places can you find that serve a drink like that?! I also stalked One Shot Cafe's instagram and was basically drooling over their posts of housemade cronuts, other baked goods, and brunch specials.

My boyfriend and I actually were staying at the opposite end of the city, but we woke up early and made the 45-60 minute trek because I had my mind set on it. One Shot is tucked away in a corner in a transitioning neighborhood; it's a hidden treasure. It is a narrow cafe with some plush cushion seating and outdoor tables. Unbeknownst to me, there is also an upstairs area with more seating that looks like the perfect spot to cozy up with a cup of coffee or tea.

One Shot has a glass case displaying their freshly baked goods, an extensive coffee menu above, AND an actual food menu. My boyfriend and I both ordered off their daily specials menu, but honestly, I wanted to try everything on their regular menu as well. They have a beautiful menu featuring drink specials that is designed by an artist each week (which I learned from stalking their Instagram) hanging behind the cashier, and this week's theme was Hawai'i. 

The boyfriend opted for the Italian pork roll breakfast burrito (scrambled eggs, potatoes, sauteed onion, cheddar, long hots, served with sweet pepper salsa & garden greens). I got the croissant french toast with mixed berry compote, sweet butter, & maple syrup and an iced lavender blueberry latte (2 shots hairbender sweetened with lavender & blueberry syrup), also a special for the week. 

The croissant french toast wasn't too heavy or overwhelming. The berry compote provided a sweet and tart complement to the buttery croissant. However, I kept stealing bites from my boyfriend's breakfast burrito -- the real star of the show. The burrito was slightly grilled on each side so that the tortilla had a bit of a crunch. The potatoes were also shredded hashed browns that were in the contents of the burrito rather than on the side as an afterthought. I started wishing I had gotten the breakfast burrito too. The iced latte was strong in blueberry flavor (not so much lavender) and was extremely refreshing. One sip definitely woke me up.

There were a few benches outside, but we were able to score a corner sofa seat. It was calm for a Saturday around noon, but shortly after we ordered, a line soon developed. The entire staff was extremely friendly and offering their recommendations when we were unsure of what to pick. My only gripe was that the prices were a bit steep. The breakfast for the two of us and the iced latte ended up being close to $30.

Overall, I would definitely recommend One Shot to anyone who visits Philly, and I will certainly be back. Once was simply not enough.', 'date': '2015-09-15 20:41:19', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 185, 'average_stars': 2.85, 'yelping_since': '2011-07-31 19:46:51'}}
[R8] {'review_id': 'HztpUC-NwWsjcWUtcc40kQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': '9PxNuhzOJ_nCOj4F-qQfrg', 'stars': 2.0, 'text': "I am giving One Shot two stars based in value. As far as décor goes, they get 4 stars (loss on one star for the overly cramped entrance way. They need to restructure the counter/seating). 

If you want breakfast sandwich or lunch food one shot is nice, and it tastes really good. I would even say go here for brunch if just once in your life. 

That said, kitchen shuts at 3.

However, If you want something to drink, aside from tap water, expect to pay out the nose.

There are NO FREE OR DISCOUNTED REFILLS. That alone is a massive negative. Sure, charge me a dollar a refill, I'm fine with that, on a large cup. But charge me two dollars for a *small* mug each and EVERY time? No. And don't call it medium. 

Espresso based drinks are on par or higher prices than all the other shops in the neighborhood and everyone's favorites, Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. 

They have chocolate bars that cost $10. No. Not a typo. No price listed till they ring you up. The baked goods are good, but again, no prices and very variable. I had gotten a strawberry cheesecake turnover. I don't know where the cheesecake part went, but the turnover was an empty husk with a slight tinge of strawberry jam in it. Yes it tasted good but I felt cheated anyway. 

They do offer wifi and nice couches/lounge area upstairs. And it is a great space for a decent sized group. I would say they can get four stars for those. But the price of items, it just doesn't justify it. 

The upstairs lounge area is closed at 4 PM. 

And lastly, they close at 5 PM everyday, so it doesn't work for an early evening study spot or after dinner/ work relaxation spot.", 'date': '2015-01-11 20:54:12', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 28, 'average_stars': 3.19, 'yelping_since': '2011-04-25 16:45:01'}}
[R9] {'review_id': 'J0HC1NxYEY9iKKEoBW2GeA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'wCTjDczgVB0169pcHVrtgQ', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': "Cozy, homey coffeehouse/brunchery where you can easily linger for hours. Varied assortment of specialty coffee and tea drinks, house-made baked goods -many of which are vegan-friendly-, and a brunch menu featuring seasonal specials with gourmet ingredients.  

They use Stumptown coffee beans here, so any coffee drink here is a good bet for a strong, rich taste. Really good loose leaf teas as well - I recommend getting a Loose Leaf Tea Lattes with the Almond and Toffee Supreme tea. 

For food, I recommend:
- Truffled Egg Salad (Sandwich): I love it when an egg salad is not overloaded with mayo- this one was really light, and served with arugula and radishes on a brioche. The taste of the truffle oil was really prominent, which is great because I think one can never have too much truffle oil. The sandwich is also served with a fresh potato salad tossed in vinegar and oil.
- Any Bagel Sandwich: the bagels here are delicious, and it's a shame you can't just buy a dozen off of them to take home. Breakfast Sandwich on a bagel is a good bet, and the Garden Bagel Sandwich (with cucumbers, tomatoes, and capers) comes with a generous slathering of cream cheese that seems particularly fresh, almost like it's been whipped with Greek yogurt - really yummy. 

Good, but I wasn't as excited about: 
- Stuffed French Toast: I love French toast generally, but I wish the French toast here (essentially a warm Nutella and banana sandwich) had a bit more pizazz.

Everything is a little on the pricier side for the quantity you get, particularly compared to other brunch places in the neighborhood, but fresh ingredients, friendly staff, and a seat in possibly one of the cutest coffeehouses in Philly make it worthwhile to venture out here.", 'date': '2011-07-18 16:17:22', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 97, 'average_stars': 3.78, 'yelping_since': '2010-10-29 11:43:47'}}
[R10] {'review_id': 'LFJ81ZBLeMFdpNpCd_mfqA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'V6oxffsX1-PVDHc7uw-PHA', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I would originally give this place 5 stars... The interior is pretty cool and the girl who waited on me was very sweet. 

However it was my first time here and I didn't have a stellar experience in the end. I ordered an iced coffee and the Hudson bagel. Iced coffee was pretty good.. Nothing I would go outside of my way to make a trip for but good. 

Then, the bagel. Got the Hudson bagel, no bacon (to go) got in my car and checked it out to make sure the cook got it right and... There was bacon on there. 
Okay, so I work in a bar. And I could have easily picked it off myself. I'm sure I have consumed some things non-vegetarian in the past unknowingly. But... I figured I was there and would rather have a new sandwich since I checked it before getting home. 

The girl took it without a problem and said she understood as she also doesn't eat meat.. When I got it back she told me he was in the process of making another order for someone else and gave me that one (after I questioned the timing) got to my car.. And yep. The cook just picked the bacon off.. With pieces of bacon still left behind. I didn't go back in because I didn't want to make a fuss and be all hardcore about it. However it left me with a bad taste in my mouth about One shot. To me, that is just pure laziness at it's best. 

I did eat the sandwich and survive. I'm pretty understanding. It's just a matter of the point, I asked for it not to be picked off. And it was after being assured it wasn't. Ah well.. Hope one shot reads and takes a note. And vegetarians/kosher customers beware.", 'date': '2015-03-04 18:57:23', 'useful': 3, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 41, 'average_stars': 4.0, 'yelping_since': '2013-05-12 20:25:09'}}
[R11] {'review_id': '0fxVvBKNqQjmIekFAOguLA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'brdbgrQpmbC1sTIV_W6shQ', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': 'OK, so very expensive items, beyond crappy service.... 

 i continue to b amazed by SUBTLE racism, sexism, ageism (and the list could go on) in amerikka... i mean, it exist,  even if people want 2 keep saying in the "land of the free" it doesn't.... 

what does that have 2 do with this very special place? well, whenever in the area, this former customer, buys the shops very overly priced vegan treats, but they happen to be out of them yesterday. so, the fine lady behind the counter, came outside of the shop and told this former customer and 3 children (1 small infant) that they could not sit at the tables outside of her shop with pizza (children choice of food), even though the aforementioned former customer brings her same children, to the shop for vegan treats, because it might scare other customers away seeing the children there with a pizza box and she doesn't serve pizza. 

hunh? what?! 

mind you, when the former customer went in, she perused the baking area and asked about the vegan oreo brownies and the freshness of the cookies; but maybe she didn't notice the former customer actually wanted 2 purchase something because she was so busy being cynical and snide, they were just out of vegan items other than their staple cookies (which the former customer had tried all of). 

i believe the fine rude lady identified herself as the "owner" and had the nerve 2 try and come out and speak to other customers after the incident occurred and the children were removed from "her" tables and the former customer addressed her about her inappropriate lack of customer service or sensitivity to ALL her customers, which i am not, and have put the word out with friends and others alike: this place really doesn't deserve quality customers since it lacks such quality customer service for ALL, NO MATTER SKIN COLOR OR OTHER PRESENTATION!', 'date': '2009-05-09 14:32:03', 'useful': 4, 'funny': 1, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 15, 'average_stars': 2.19, 'yelping_since': '2009-04-11 23:58:48'}}
[R12] {'review_id': 'slDTCZGsYIsVABdFAdODPQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'y3Wtx1pOvTiqsJRkjceXiw', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': "When I think of my neighborhood and how it has changed in the last eight years since I have moved here, I think of One Shot.   It really embodies Northern Liberties and has evolved much in the same way our neighborhood has.  Once tucked away on Liberties walk and a bit hidden and flying under the radar, it moved to a new location on West George and American and it just blossomed, grew into its own.  Much like our neighborhood.

I tend to wax poetically about small businesses that I really love, and One Shot is no exception.  I also have quite a warm spot in my heart for the place too, as it was where my baby shower took place.  Yep!  Did you know that One Shot's second floor can be rented for private events?  It is absolute perfection for a small, intimate affair. (baby or bridal shower, birthday party, special luncheon just because?) From soup to nuts, One Shot and owner Rebecca made it the most splendid, adorable affair.  The whole event went without a hitch, the service was impeccable, friendly and the menu crafted especially for the event was perfection (there was this caramel pot de crème, and a small paté chinois- shepherd's pie - a nod to my french canadian heritage, and the most yummy macarons, amongst other delicious tidbits that were to die for!).   

 It doesn't hurt that the whole place is so uniquely gorgeous.  The artwork, the lighting, repurposed vintage items, the open space design that still makes the place feel cozy and personal, the beautiful bathrooms (seriously beautiful bathrooms), the cute curved booths on the first floor and the seating upstairs, it just works, you know?  

The coffee is super strong  (like I like it) and the food is killer.  Go there early in the morning and experience their baked goods hot and fresh out of the oven.  This morning, for example, had a blueberry and peach scone that rocked my world.  It's the little things.  All their baked goods are super yummy, and don't get me started on their breakfast, brunch menu - sweet baby jesus - their ultimate breakfast sandwich contains some of my most favorite items on earth: a brioche bun, brie, bacon, hash brown and two fried eggs.  Hello lover.  Breakfast of champions right there.  Just give it a whirl, you won't ever look back.

It's the perfect place to grab a quick dose of caffeine, or while away your hours as you nibble on a croissant and get caught up on your blog lovin', or go upstairs where it's quieter with one of their daily crafted non-caffeinated options and catch up on your reading (with a book, not a kindle).", 'date': '2013-08-24 12:56:33', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 371, 'average_stars': 3.39, 'yelping_since': '2008-12-15 23:29:58'}}
[R13] {'review_id': '-Ud26slhSbT4iqK7xkOaZw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'GZswAWJPk8y_ULowr--a4g', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': 'I find it hard to review coffee shops.  It's kind of like reviewing a movie - how you feel about it is not only based on THEIR effort, the cinematography, the writing, the casting, etc etc... it's also based on everything you've been through in your life up until the day you see the movie.  Reviewing coffee shops - not an objective practice in any way.  The reviews help, sure, especially if all 30 of them say, "I got food poisoning from the camembert quiche."  Sure, take THEM to heart. But don't weigh too heavily in general.

That said, let me get down from my soap box and talk about One Shot.  I really like it there.  Sometimes, I am treated like a queen (mostly, when I go see my beautiful friend Kelly who I love a lot and who I think is a great barista), and sometimes I am treated like a slightly annoying citizen.  But that's life, and I do not need my ass kissed 24/7, even in the service industry.  (If you think a barista's job is to make you feel like the most important little latte drinking princess in the world, I suggest you buy a coffee maker.)  The coffee/espresso is lovely and does what it's supposed to, like a charm.  The food is inventive and consistently prepared, and the prices are competitive.  The music is enjoyable and the vibe is deliciously relaxed, especially for a shop that resides in a shiny, glossed over, gentrified mini-mall in the middle of a neighborhood halfway between Hipster Heaven and Get Out, We Were Here First.  I like when the sun spills into the windows onto the slouchy, old furniture.  I like to go when I can't look at my work laptop anymore and I need a tiny little dose of Yay Life Rules.  So, from a totally biased perspective, influenced by every other coffee shop I've ever been to (or worked in, god help me), I highly recommend One Shot.', 'date': '2009-09-25 03:01:59', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 42, 'average_stars': 4.14, 'yelping_since': '2009-09-23 18:16:44'}}
[R14] {'review_id': 'XGrbDdEQT4kEyCRMMKM9jQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'KFFIyUxC0TQjx__OYlmhnA', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': "Downgrade.

I like so many things about this place, but I think I may stop going.  I really don't think they appreciate their customers at all.  The food and coffee are good enough, but lately I've been thinking I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.  I guess it won't matter to them though, because there seems to be an endless parade of the tattooed hip to spend money there all the same.

Two instances come to mind.

On a hot day, I wanted a really cold drink.  I chose the beet juice from the open cooler in the front - it didn't really seem very cold, so I asked if I could have some ice for it.  This drink costs almost $7, but the woman at the counter had the gall to charge me 50 cents for it.  Yeah, I know, it's only 50 cents, but come on.  I am spending $7 for the drink, not to mention the rest of the food we got.  Last I heard, ice wasn't a very expensive item for restaurants to supply. Most will just give it to you for free.

Also, another time it was winter, and I got one of their fancy overpriced hot drink specials on the specials board.  When I took my first sip, it was kind of luke warm.  I asked if they could just please pop it in the microwave for me to heat it up a bit.  The woman (I think one of the owners) looked at me with a face of HORROR and spit out her words in disgust UGHHHH!!!!  We don't have a MICROWAVE HERE!!!!!!!!!!   So I asked what she could do for me, she said UGH!!! I GUESS I CAN PUT A SHOT OF ESPRESSO IN THERE, BUT THATS IT!!!!!!!!

So the drink I probably paid over $5 for, which was lukewarm, and SHOULD HAVE BEEN NICELY REMADE FOR ME, if you didn't have a microwave, was made 1% warmer with the addition of espresso.  In addition, she yelled at me in front of everyone in line, humiliating me.  Owner or not, she needs some lessons in customer service.

Pro tip - Cafe Chismosa is right down the street with better coffee, better food, better prices AND better customer service.", 'date': '2013-08-12 13:39:48', 'useful': 16, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 253, 'average_stars': 4.02, 'yelping_since': '2010-02-03 19:34:00'}}
[R15] {'review_id': 'h1BNupk55yL7eUaURerFkw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'BWIY6Conafv_fr5msSMWOA', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': "One Shot Coffee & Café might just be my favorite coffee shop ever. Somehow the excellent food, quality espresso beverages and well thought out décor amassed in a perfect permutation, making our breakfast at One Shot one of the most delightful parts of our recent trip to Philly. 

As I waited at a table by a window I could quickly tell by glancing around that the owners and workers care wholeheartedly about the product they put out and the happiness of their customers. Their dedication, work ethic and contentment were readily apparent by even the most cursory observation. Similarly, a peek at the tables and a glance at the quickly moving line showed one of the most diverse crowds I've ever seen at a coffee house - a real testament to this shop as it appeals to everyone.

Unfortunately I'm not a Philadelphian so I can't come here regularly, and even more unfortunate, we had only popped in to fulfill my morning need for coffee and grab an edible accompaniment, we weren't going to stay for a full lunch. We decided to split the Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich (brioche bun, brie, bacon, giant hash brown, two eggs with just enough runniness) and selected our drinks, then Justin went to order while I camped out at the table. When he came back he had one of their Mexican chocolate cronuts with him. It's the little things in life that make the biggest difference and this was no exception - not only because it was an awesome cronut with great flavor and texture and paired well with my cappuccino, but because my partner has impeccable taste and knows exactly what I will like. 

After we finished our breakfast we took a turn around the café. Both upstairs and downstairs are absolutely adorable. Each vintage element is placed perfectly and seems like it would have a story. The upstairs is much less hectic, has a little library and would be the perfect place to sit and catch up with a girlfriend over brunch. The menus of specials are hand written and decorated on giant butcher paper rolls - love it. Even the downstairs bathroom is beautiful with its old fashioned lace curtain and mock window. 

The concept, design and execution of every aspect of One Shot are perfect. There is nothing here not to love.", 'date': '2014-11-30 15:01:43', 'useful': 3, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 366, 'average_stars': 3.83, 'yelping_since': '2009-12-07 06:18:42'}}
[R16] {'review_id': 'Sf_OXKM24bUABtcQ8NbsvQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': '9GFQsyVuZpqLsv4rgX2Ojg', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I looked forward to trying this place out because their Insta feed is always really awesome.  What I came to find was the food was alright and the coffee was slightly above par.  Here's what I got:

Coffee - I just got the regular black drip coffee because I feel like that is the best way for you to know just how good a cafe's coffee really is.  While I wasn't disappointed with it, it also was nothing to write home about.  With how competitive the coffee market is in Philly, this isn't something I would immediately recommend to a visiting coffee coffee snob.  My girlfriend got a latte that was pretty damn good, and maybe that's One Shot's claim to fame more than anything.  Coffee isn't bad and it's a definite good place to stop in and have a cup - just nothing that I'd be running back to week in and week out.

Food - I got the Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich which I thought was going to be phenomenal.  It was very good, but once again, it wasn't quite what I was expecting (in a negative way).  The brioche bun was fairly bland and added little to the overall sandwich while the hashbrown was probably the best part of the entire thing.  Brie wasn't necessarily the best selection of cheese for this sandwich either that lacked a true *oomph* factor.  I was left wanting more in the area of flavor.  I would probably eat this again, but not before trying something different on their menu.  I'd suggest if you're going to One Shot for breakfast, stick to their specials.  This is what fills their social media accounts most often and probably is their best offering.  I didn't mind this place but definitely have much better places I'd rather go for breakfast or brunch.", 'date': '2015-12-26 17:28:04', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 52, 'average_stars': 4.13, 'yelping_since': '2014-03-07 17:34:47'}}
[R17] {'review_id': 'OsPq_wmpHNVZ2x8t_Eg-IQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'fo2c2mfebLM-5x0iFU3ZJA', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': "We came here today (not far from our house) because I saw on Yelp that there were a LOT of reviews and the total was 4 stars...already a good sign!  We pull up and we got lucky- parking right outside the place.  I have a feeling though that if we didn't get lucky, we would have had to park a couple blocks down because the parking isnt the best.  With that aside, we walked into this little corner shop tucked away nicely and was immediately greeted by the staff behind the counter.  The decor was warm, cozy and antique which I love.  Exposed walls, original ceilings, old fashioned light bulbs fashioned into unique lighting fixtures, the whole deal (see pictures).   I ordered the garden bagel and my boyfriend got the ultimate breakfast. Analyze which aspect of the restaurant is prioritized by 'useful' reviews.

3. PRIORITIZED_ASPECT: "service" if AVG_USEFUL_SERVICE > AVG_USEFUL_FOOD, "food" if vice-versa, else "draw".
4. AVG_STARS_PRIORITIZED: Average star rating of the reviews in the prioritized group (2 decimal places).

After your analysis, output your final answers in EXACTLY this format:

AVG_USEFUL_SERVICE: [decimal]
AVG_USEFUL_FOOD: [decimal]
PRIORITIZED_ASPECT: [string]

===END===

Final answers

AVG_USEFUL_SERVICE: 4.58

[R2] {'review_id': 'J2QTvRD9rLRLRKR-sIorTQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': '7Q22MHgNrcQoH1xBs4fH0w', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': "A hidden gem if I have to say so myself, this small cafe in Philly is a great brunch place with a very distinct character. [R4] {'review_id': '7o3ketA0Ik-fItVgt5pkWA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'HW-QgyCq4DzUQCFRaYn6Fg', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I've been to one shot a few times, and I have mixed feelings. [R6] {'review_id': '2iQ4e11Aw34gR_Grf6u4Cw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'jzMPqVNvZRdS47Iydiomrg', 'stars': 2.0, 'text': 'I walked in from a chilly morning to have it get chilled even further by a blasé staff.
I typically just come in to buy coffee in bulk, and now I'm remembering why I'd rather just order it online (or SHOT TOWER!) and brew it myself in the comfort of my own home. 
I walked in at 10am, got the briefing on some specials by one barista, quickly reviewed the menu to see if there's anything new, and casually made my way to the register to order.
I attempted to order the early special (8am-10am, bagel and a 12oz. coffee), but it was 10:04, and the staff just sorta gave me a *sighing, couldn't believe I'd ask* look (the same look was rehearsed a second time when my companion asked for the internet password).
I guess for all technicality's sake, I shouldn't get the early morning special that ends at 10am at 10:04, but when I've been lingering and making small talk with the staff for 4 minutes, I figured some air of humanity would prevail...Instead, I ended up with an antiseptic answer I'd expect from a automated calling system...Needless to say, I didn't get the special. 
I get it, I'm ordering after 10am. Maybe the system you use to complete transactions wouldn't allow you to process the request - but I find that hard to believe, and harder to believe there isn't a way around that if it was the case...Its not like the kitchen's packed and cleaned up the bagels, or the coffee at 10:01. Its just not the kind of service I would've predicted from such an otherwise solid establishment - especially when other, closer-to-home coffee shop options are available - doesn't competition drive some sense of flexibility or courtesy to the customer - its Monday morning for all of us, right? $4 for a bagel and 12oz. of coffee is still delivering a substantial profit no matter what time of day you're ordering it. 
I ended up ordering a tofu breakfast burrito (I'm vegan, it was admittedly good), and the coffee is always good (kinda hard to "F" up Stumptown brews anyway), but after that experience, my order stopped there. The primary point I'm trying to make here is that I would've ordered more food which would've also included following through on my whole whimsical inspiration to go there in the first place - to order a special coffee, or dirty chai etc. - something I can't or don't feel like making at home - which would've consequently resulted in me handing over more money (the price tags were already at the higher end for what I think is reasonable), and more tips (I still tipped - I'm not that shallow) to the establishment as a whole.
And, last but not least - left with a 'pleasant taste' of the place in general instead of the nagging desire to write this - my first  - Yelp! review. 
I kick myself now for not at least using their wifi to do so. 
While I'm at it...I may as well also make a quick stab about the music - good choices, in fact, the ambience of this place is pretty much flawless -  but if you're going to play it off your iPhone, put that shit in Airplane mode so I don't have to hear it pause and beep through the speakers every time you get a new notification.', 'date': '2012-02-13 19:24:24', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 1, 'user': {'review_count': 2, 'average_stars': 3.0, 'yelping_since': '2010-11-26 15:45:41'}}
[R7] {'review_id': 'MczN3OBeL-3xVRyxoysLcA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'Jsv94uvmVEcyshiGhP2uuw', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': '"You've only got one shot, so make it count."

One Shot is all you need.

I first heard about One Shot Coffee from an old friend and immediately put it on my Philly bucket list when she told me about the blueberry apple pie chai she had. I mean, how many places can you find that serve a drink like that?! I also stalked One Shot Cafe's instagram and was basically drooling over their posts of housemade cronuts, other baked goods, and brunch specials.

My boyfriend and I actually were staying at the opposite end of the city, but we woke up early and made the 45-60 minute trek because I had my mind set on it. One Shot is tucked away in a corner in a transitioning neighborhood; it's a hidden treasure. It is a narrow cafe with some plush cushion seating and outdoor tables. Unbeknownst to me, there is also an upstairs area with more seating that looks like the perfect spot to cozy up with a cup of coffee or tea.

One Shot has a glass case displaying their freshly baked goods, an extensive coffee menu above, AND an actual food menu. My boyfriend and I both ordered off their daily specials menu, but honestly, I wanted to try everything on their regular menu as well. They have a beautiful menu featuring drink specials that is designed by an artist each week (which I learned from stalking their Instagram) hanging behind the cashier, and this week's theme was Hawai'i. 

The boyfriend opted for the Italian pork roll breakfast burrito (scrambled eggs, potatoes, sauteed onion, cheddar, long hots, served with sweet pepper salsa & garden greens). I got the croissant french toast with mixed berry compote, sweet butter, & maple syrup and an iced lavender blueberry latte (2 shots hairbender sweetened with lavender & blueberry syrup), also a special for the week. 

The croissant french toast wasn't too heavy or overwhelming. The berry compote provided a sweet and tart complement to the buttery croissant. However, I kept stealing bites from my boyfriend's breakfast burrito -- the real star of the show. The burrito was slightly grilled on each side so that the tortilla had a bit of a crunch. The potatoes were also shredded hashed browns that were in the contents of the burrito rather than on the side as an afterthought. I started wishing I had gotten the breakfast burrito too. The iced latte was strong in blueberry flavor (not so much lavender) and was extremely refreshing. One sip definitely woke me up.

There were a few benches outside, but we were able to score a corner sofa seat. It was calm for a Saturday around noon, but shortly after we ordered, a line soon developed. The entire staff was extremely friendly and offering their recommendations when we were unsure of what to pick. My only gripe was that the prices were a bit steep. The breakfast for the two of us and the iced latte ended up being close to $30.

Overall, I would definitely recommend One Shot to anyone who visits Philly, and I will certainly be back. Once was simply not enough.', 'date': '2015-09-15 20:41:19', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 185, 'average_stars': 2.85, 'yelping_since': '2011-07-31 19:46:51'}}
[R8] {'review_id': 'HztpUC-NwWsjcWUtcc40kQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': '9PxNuhzOJ_nCOj4F-qQfrg', 'stars': 2.0, 'text': "I am giving One Shot two stars based in value. As far as décor goes, they get 4 stars (loss on one star for the overly cramped entrance way. They need to restructure the counter/seating). 

If you want breakfast sandwich or lunch food one shot is nice, and it tastes really good. I would even say go here for brunch if just once in your life. 

That said, kitchen shuts at 3.

However, If you want something to drink, aside from tap water, expect to pay out the nose.

There are NO FREE OR DISCOUNTED REFILLS. That alone is a massive negative. Sure, charge me a dollar a refill, I'm fine with that, on a large cup. But charge me two dollars for a *small* mug each and EVERY time? No. And don't call it medium. 

Espresso based drinks are on par or higher prices than all the other shops in the neighborhood and everyone's favorites, Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. 

They have chocolate bars that cost $10. No. Not a typo. No price listed till they ring you up. The baked goods are good, but again, no prices and very variable. I had gotten a strawberry cheesecake turnover. I don't know where the cheesecake part went, but the turnover was an empty husk with a slight tinge of strawberry jam in it. Yes it tasted good but I felt cheated anyway. 

They do offer wifi and nice couches/lounge area upstairs. And it is a great space for a decent sized group. I would say they can get four stars for those. But the price of items, it just doesn't justify it. 

The upstairs lounge area is closed at 4 PM. 

And lastly, they close at 5 PM everyday, so it doesn't work for an early evening study spot or after dinner/ work relaxation spot.", 'date': '2015-01-11 20:54:12', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 28, 'average_stars': 3.19, 'yelping_since': '2011-04-25 16:45:01'}}
[R9] {'review_id': 'J0HC1NxYEY9iKKEoBW2GeA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'wCTjDczgVB0169pcHVrtgQ', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': "Cozy, homey coffeehouse/brunchery where you can easily linger for hours. Varied assortment of specialty coffee and tea drinks, house-made baked goods -many of which are vegan-friendly-, and a brunch menu featuring seasonal specials with gourmet ingredients.  

They use Stumptown coffee beans here, so any coffee drink here is a good bet for a strong, rich taste. Really good loose leaf teas as well - I recommend getting a Loose Leaf Tea Lattes with the Almond and Toffee Supreme tea. 

For food, I recommend:
- Truffled Egg Salad (Sandwich): I love it when an egg salad is not overloaded with mayo- this one was really light, and served with arugula and radishes on a brioche. The taste of the truffle oil was really prominent, which is great because I think one can never have too much truffle oil. The sandwich is also served with a fresh potato salad tossed in vinegar and oil.
- Any Bagel Sandwich: the bagels here are delicious, and it's a shame you can't just buy a dozen off of them to take home. Breakfast Sandwich on a bagel is a good bet, and the Garden Bagel Sandwich (with cucumbers, tomatoes, and capers) comes with a generous slathering of cream cheese that seems particularly fresh, almost like it's been whipped with Greek yogurt - really yummy. 

Good, but I wasn't as excited about: 
- Stuffed French Toast: I love French toast generally, but I wish the French toast here (essentially a warm Nutella and banana sandwich) had a bit more pizazz.

Everything is a little on the pricier side for the quantity you get, particularly compared to other brunch places in the neighborhood, but fresh ingredients, friendly staff, and a seat in possibly one of the cutest coffeehouses in Philly make it worthwhile to venture out here.", 'date': '2011-07-18 16:17:22', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 97, 'average_stars': 3.78, 'yelping_since': '2010-10-29 11:43:47'}}
[R10] {'review_id': 'LFJ81ZBLeMFdpNpCd_mfqA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'V6oxffsX1-PVDHc7uw-PHA', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I would originally give this place 5 stars... The interior is pretty cool and the girl who waited on me was very sweet. 

However it was my first time here and I didn't have a stellar experience in the end. I ordered an iced coffee and the Hudson bagel. Iced coffee was pretty good.. Nothing I would go outside of my way to make a trip for but good. 

Then, the bagel. Got the Hudson bagel, no bacon (to go) got in my car and checked it out to make sure the cook got it right and... There was bacon on there. 
Okay, so I work in a bar. And I could have easily picked it off myself. I'm sure I have consumed some things non-vegetarian in the past unknowingly. But... I figured I was there and would rather have a new sandwich since I checked it before getting home. 

The girl took it without a problem and said she understood as she also doesn't eat meat.. When I got it back she told me he was in the process of making another order for someone else and gave me that one (after I questioned the timing) got to my car.. And yep. The cook just picked the bacon off.. With pieces of bacon still left behind. I didn't go back in because I didn't want to make a fuss and be all hardcore about it. However it left me with a bad taste in my mouth about One shot. To me, that is just pure laziness at it's best. 

I did eat the sandwich and survive. I'm pretty understanding. It's just a matter of the point, I asked for it not to be picked off. And it was after being assured it wasn't. Ah well.. Hope one shot reads and takes a note. And vegetarians/kosher customers beware.", 'date': '2015-03-04 18:57:23', 'useful': 3, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 41, 'average_stars': 4.0, 'yelping_since': '2013-05-12 20:25:09'}}
[R11] {'review_id': '0fxVvBKNqQjmIekFAOguLA', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'brdbgrQpmbC1sTIV_W6shQ', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': 'OK, so very expensive items, beyond crappy service.... 

 i continue to b amazed by SUBTLE racism, sexism, ageism (and the list could go on) in amerikka... i mean, it exist,  even if people want 2 keep saying in the "land of the free" it doesn't.... 

what does that have 2 do with this very special place? well, whenever in the area, this former customer, buys the shops very overly priced vegan treats, but they happen to be out of them yesterday. so, the fine lady behind the counter, came outside of the shop and told this former customer and 3 children (1 small infant) that they could not sit at the tables outside of her shop with pizza (children choice of food), even though the aforementioned former customer brings her same children, to the shop for vegan treats, because it might scare other customers away seeing the children there with a pizza box and she doesn't serve pizza. 

hunh? what?! 

mind you, when the former customer went in, she perused the baking area and asked about the vegan oreo brownies and the freshness of the cookies; but maybe she didn't notice the former customer actually wanted 2 purchase something because she was so busy being cynical and snide, they were just out of vegan items other than their staple cookies (which the former customer had tried all of). 

i believe the fine rude lady identified herself as the "owner" and had the nerve 2 try and come out and speak to other customers after the incident occurred and the children were removed from "her" tables and the former customer addressed her about her inappropriate lack of customer service or sensitivity to ALL her customers, which i am not, and have put the word out with friends and others alike: this place really doesn't deserve quality customers since it lacks such quality customer service for ALL, NO MATTER SKIN COLOR OR OTHER PRESENTATION!', 'date': '2009-05-09 14:32:03', 'useful': 4, 'funny': 1, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 15, 'average_stars': 2.19, 'yelping_since': '2009-04-11 23:58:48'}}
[R12] {'review_id': 'slDTCZGsYIsVABdFAdODPQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'y3Wtx1pOvTiqsJRkjceXiw', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': "When I think of my neighborhood and how it has changed in the last eight years since I have moved here, I think of One Shot.   It really embodies Northern Liberties and has evolved much in the same way our neighborhood has.  Once tucked away on Liberties walk and a bit hidden and flying under the radar, it moved to a new location on West George and American and it just blossomed, grew into its own.  Much like our neighborhood.

I tend to wax poetically about small businesses that I really love, and One Shot is no exception.  I also have quite a warm spot in my heart for the place too, as it was where my baby shower took place.  Yep!  Did you know that One Shot's second floor can be rented for private events?  It is absolute perfection for a small, intimate affair. (baby or bridal shower, birthday party, special luncheon just because?) From soup to nuts, One Shot and owner Rebecca made it the most splendid, adorable affair.  The whole event went without a hitch, the service was impeccable, friendly and the menu crafted especially for the event was perfection (there was this caramel pot de crème, and a small paté chinois- shepherd's pie - a nod to my french canadian heritage, and the most yummy macarons, amongst other delicious tidbits that were to die for!).   

 It doesn't hurt that the whole place is so uniquely gorgeous.  The artwork, the lighting, repurposed vintage items, the open space design that still makes the place feel cozy and personal, the beautiful bathrooms (seriously beautiful bathrooms), the cute curved booths on the first floor and the seating upstairs, it just works, you know?  

The coffee is super strong  (like I like it) and the food is killer.  Go there early in the morning and experience their baked goods hot and fresh out of the oven.  This morning, for example, had a blueberry and peach scone that rocked my world.  It's the little things.  All their baked goods are super yummy, and don't get me started on their breakfast, brunch menu - sweet baby jesus - their ultimate breakfast sandwich contains some of my most favorite items on earth: a brioche bun, brie, bacon, hash brown and two fried eggs.  Hello lover.  Breakfast of champions right there.  Just give it a whirl, you won't ever look back.

It's the perfect place to grab a quick dose of caffeine, or while away your hours as you nibble on a croissant and get caught up on your blog lovin', or go upstairs where it's quieter with one of their daily crafted non-caffeinated options and catch up on your reading (with a book, not a kindle).", 'date': '2013-08-24 12:56:33', 'useful': 2, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 371, 'average_stars': 3.39, 'yelping_since': '2008-12-15 23:29:58'}}
[R13] {'review_id': '-Ud26slhSbT4iqK7xkOaZw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'GZswAWJPk8y_ULowr--a4g', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': 'I find it hard to review coffee shops.  It's kind of like reviewing a movie - how you feel about it is not only based on THEIR effort, the cinematography, the writing, the casting, etc etc... it's also based on everything you've been through in your life up until the day you see the movie.  Reviewing coffee shops - not an objective practice in any way.  The reviews help, sure, especially if all 30 of them say, "I got food poisoning from the camembert quiche."  Sure, take THEM to heart. But don't weigh too heavily in general.

That said, let me get down from my soap box and talk about One Shot.  I really like it there.  Sometimes, I am treated like a queen (mostly, when I go see my beautiful friend Kelly who I love a lot and who I think is a great barista), and sometimes I am treated like a slightly annoying citizen.  But that's life, and I do not need my ass kissed 24/7, even in the service industry.  (If you think a barista's job is to make you feel like the most important little latte drinking princess in the world, I suggest you buy a coffee maker.)  The coffee/espresso is lovely and does what it's supposed to, like a charm.  The food is inventive and consistently prepared, and the prices are competitive.  The music is enjoyable and the vibe is deliciously relaxed, especially for a shop that resides in a shiny, glossed over, gentrified mini-mall in the middle of a neighborhood halfway between Hipster Heaven and Get Out, We Were Here First.  I like when the sun spills into the windows onto the slouchy, old furniture.  I like to go when I can't look at my work laptop anymore and I need a tiny little dose of Yay Life Rules.  So, from a totally biased perspective, influenced by every other coffee shop I've ever been to (or worked in, god help me), I highly recommend One Shot.', 'date': '2009-09-25 03:01:59', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 42, 'average_stars': 4.14, 'yelping_since': '2009-09-23 18:16:44'}}
[R14] {'review_id': 'XGrbDdEQT4kEyCRMMKM9jQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'KFFIyUxC0TQjx__OYlmhnA', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': "Downgrade.

I like so many things about this place, but I think I may stop going.  I really don't think they appreciate their customers at all.  The food and coffee are good enough, but lately I've been thinking I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.  I guess it won't matter to them though, because there seems to be an endless parade of the tattooed hip to spend money there all the same.

Two instances come to mind.

On a hot day, I wanted a really cold drink.  I chose the beet juice from the open cooler in the front - it didn't really seem very cold, so I asked if I could have some ice for it.  This drink costs almost $7, but the woman at the counter had the gall to charge me 50 cents for it.  Yeah, I know, it's only 50 cents, but come on.  I am spending $7 for the drink, not to mention the rest of the food we got.  Last I heard, ice wasn't a very expensive item for restaurants to supply. Most will just give it to you for free.

Also, another time it was winter, and I got one of their fancy overpriced hot drink specials on the specials board.  When I took my first sip, it was kind of luke warm.  I asked if they could just please pop it in the microwave for me to heat it up a bit.  The woman (I think one of the owners) looked at me with a face of HORROR and spit out her words in disgust UGHHHH!!!!  We don't have a MICROWAVE HERE!!!!!!!!!!   So I asked what she could do for me, she said UGH!!! I GUESS I CAN PUT A SHOT OF ESPRESSO IN THERE, BUT THATS IT!!!!!!!!

So the drink I probably paid over $5 for, which was lukewarm, and SHOULD HAVE BEEN NICELY REMADE FOR ME, if you didn't have a microwave, was made 1% warmer with the addition of espresso.  In addition, she yelled at me in front of everyone in line, humiliating me.  Owner or not, she needs some lessons in customer service.

Pro tip - Cafe Chismosa is right down the street with better coffee, better food, better prices AND better customer service.", 'date': '2013-08-12 13:39:48', 'useful': 16, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 253, 'average_stars': 4.02, 'yelping_since': '2010-02-03 19:34:00'}}
[R15] {'review_id': 'h1BNupk55yL7eUaURerFkw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'BWIY6Conafv_fr5msSMWOA', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': "One Shot Coffee & Café might just be my favorite coffee shop ever. Somehow the excellent food, quality espresso beverages and well thought out décor amassed in a perfect permutation, making our breakfast at One Shot one of the most delightful parts of our recent trip to Philly. 

As I waited at a table by a window I could quickly tell by glancing around that the owners and workers care wholeheartedly about the product they put out and the happiness of their customers. Their dedication, work ethic and contentment were readily apparent by even the most cursory observation. Similarly, a peek at the tables and a glance at the quickly moving line showed one of the most diverse crowds I've ever seen at a coffee house - a real testament to this shop as it appeals to everyone.

Unfortunately I'm not a Philadelphian so I can't come here regularly, and even more unfortunate, we had only popped in to fulfill my morning need for coffee and grab an edible accompaniment, we weren't going to stay for a full lunch. We decided to split the Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich (brioche bun, brie, bacon, giant hash brown, two eggs with just enough runniness) and selected our drinks, then Justin went to order while I camped out at the table. When he came back he had one of their Mexican chocolate cronuts with him. It's the little things in life that make the biggest difference and this was no exception - not only because it was an awesome cronut with great flavor and texture and paired well with my cappuccino, but because my partner has impeccable taste and knows exactly what I will like. 

After we finished our breakfast we took a turn around the café. Both upstairs and downstairs are absolutely adorable. Each vintage element is placed perfectly and seems like it would have a story. The upstairs is much less hectic, has a little library and would be the perfect place to sit and catch up with a girlfriend over brunch. The menus of specials are hand written and decorated on giant butcher paper rolls - love it. Even the downstairs bathroom is beautiful with its old fashioned lace curtain and mock window. 

The concept, design and execution of every aspect of One Shot are perfect. There is nothing here not to love.", 'date': '2014-11-30 15:01:43', 'useful': 3, 'funny': 2, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 366, 'average_stars': 3.83, 'yelping_since': '2009-12-07 06:18:42'}}
[R16] {'review_id': 'Sf_OXKM24bUABtcQ8NbsvQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': '9GFQsyVuZpqLsv4rgX2Ojg', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I looked forward to trying this place out because their Insta feed is always really awesome.  What I came to find was the food was alright and the coffee was slightly above par.  Here's what I got:

Coffee - I just got the regular black drip coffee because I feel like that is the best way for you to know just how good a cafe's coffee really is.  While I wasn't disappointed with it, it also was nothing to write home about.  With how competitive the coffee market is in Philly, this isn't something I would immediately recommend to a visiting coffee coffee snob.  My girlfriend got a latte that was pretty damn good, and maybe that's One Shot's claim to fame more than anything.  Coffee isn't bad and it's a definite good place to stop in and have a cup - just nothing that I'd be running back to week in and week out.

Food - I got the Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich which I thought was going to be phenomenal.  It was very good, but once again, it wasn't quite what I was expecting (in a negative way).  The brioche bun was fairly bland and added little to the overall sandwich while the hashbrown was probably the best part of the entire thing.  Brie wasn't necessarily the best selection of cheese for this sandwich either that lacked a true *oomph* factor.  I was left wanting more in the area of flavor.  I would probably eat this again, but not before trying something different on their menu.  I'd suggest if you're going to One Shot for breakfast, stick to their specials.  This is what fills their social media accounts most often and probably is their best offering.  I didn't mind this place but definitely have much better places I'd rather go for breakfast or brunch.", 'date': '2015-12-26 17:28:04', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 0, 'cool': 0, 'user': {'review_count': 52, 'average_stars': 4.13, 'yelping_since': '2014-03-07 17:34:47'}}
[R17] {'review_id': 'OsPq_wmpHNVZ2x8t_Eg-IQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'fo2c2mfebLM-5x0iFU3ZJA', 'stars': 4.0, 'text': "We came here today (not far from our house) because I saw on Yelp that there were a LOT of reviews and the total was 4 stars...already a good sign!  We pull up and we got lucky- parking right outside the place.  I have a feeling though that if we didn't get lucky, we would have had to park a couple blocks down because the parking isnt the best.  With that aside, we walked into this little corner shop tucked away nicely and was immediately greeted by the staff behind the counter.  The decor was warm, cozy and antique which I love.  Exposed walls, original ceilings, old fashioned light bulbs fashioned into unique lighting fixtures, the whole deal (see pictures).   I ordered the garden bagel and my boyfriend got the ultimate breakfast.  He got an iced coffee with a touch of hazelnut and I ordered a cappuccino with almond milk (dairy milk sensitivity) AND he ordered a maple bacon kronut and i got the glazed kronut.  We took our kronuts to a table near the window and he ranted and raved about the maple bacon (though I dont see the fascination with putting bacon on everything- it still tasted good and to my satisfaction, i couldnt even taste the bacon).  My glazed kronut was good but i think it had something to do with the croissant but it sort of tasted like it was just a stale doughnut.  Either way, they were good enough.  Then the coffees came out and of course we were pleased (though I wouldnt recommend ever getting a cappuccino with almond milk- even if you ARE sensitive to dairy milk, it tastes weird).  The bagel came out quickly with the ultimate breakfast and we were in heaven.  I am from long island and I have yet to eat a bagel here that could even touch long island but this might have been it!  I got a pumpernickel bagel and the whole thing was incredible! delicious to the last bite as was my boyfriends meal.  Perfectly done on both parts, good job One Shot!  I also have to mention the upstairs; quaint, comfy, cozy, and reminiscent of my grandma's living room (in a VERY good way!)  I could have stayed up there all day.  The prices were a little steep (which took away from 5 stars) but that is to be expected in this area I suppose.  As long as you come prepared with $30 for two people for breakfast items, then you're good to go!", 'date': '2014-10-23 16:31:29', 'useful': 1, 'funny': 1, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 73, 'average_stars': 3.75, 'yelping_since': '2012-04-05 13:48:30'}}
[R18] {'review_id': 'dFl7Dl8JghkMrALpyKxTgQ', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'ocFniU3muXVYiwB-ieuMHQ', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': 'I met some people here at 7:30 AM for a business meeting, and ordered a small latte and a plain bagel. The tab was $7.50. Seven-fifty??? I'm trying to make that add up to something approaching reasonable, and failing. 

Then I went upstairs to our meeting, which was held on the couches in the back. The music was blaring so loudly that we were unable to hear each other speak. It was 7:30 in the morning and we were the only people there. We went downstairs to ask if the music could be turned down, and were aggressively refused, with a side of personal insults. 

If my group does not find another place to meet, next time I will bring a thermos. This place does not deserve our business.

UPDATE: Response from 'Melissa B., Owner':

I am sorry that you had a business meeting upstairs and that the music was "too loud."  We actually have hosted many business meetings upstairs for patrons that would like to rent out our second floor and $7.50 for a Stumptown Latte, bagel and a business meeting is pretty darn fair.

Me: Not really understanding the scare quotes in this response. "Too loud" means "so loud that normal conversation is impossible." Are you implying that there is something wrong with me and my associates for being unable to hear one another over ambient music at 7:30 AM, or for bringing it to your attention in the first place? Do you really feel that insulting your patrons--both in person and by email--is good business practice?', 'date': '2011-11-11 17:31:11', 'useful': 17, 'funny': 4, 'cool': 6, 'user': {'review_count': 18, 'average_stars': 2.9, 'yelping_since': '2008-09-08 17:29:49'}}
[R19] {'review_id': 'G_qCyxaK1Q9_O89Sdl2Cvw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'haebF6ELoYWkHcwODPPBmw', 'stars': 1.0, 'text': "I challenge any restaurant owner to dine at any establishment that serves breakfast, spend $40.00 for two people, ask for jam (for the toast) when the food arrives, and then instructed to see the cashier to pay $.53 to not be upset by the utter cheapness and pettiness of said establishment.

Please explain the following logic to me. A Tom's Dirty Chai is listed on the menu for $5.50. My bill comes to $7.16. When I queried the blonde millennial with the nose hoop, she said they charge extra for ice, the extra shot, and for breve.

If I didn't have ice, they would have filled the remainder of the cup with milk. According to the greed inspired mathematics at One Shoot, ice costs more than milk!

I didn't order an extra shot. The Dirty Chai already has a shot...that's why it's called Dirty!

I'm already paying a crap load for a beverage that's mostly ice, why charge for half and half especially since they have a container of it on the counter that's free to use?!?

Thank god I didn't tell them I needed a straw or I would have had to hit the ATM.

If looking cool while getting taken advantage of by an establishment that uses carnival like pricing shenanigans gets your motor running, then get ready for a nitro infused experience that will get you to the checkered flag (albeit at the cost of your engine). 

Apparently I'm that guy since I'm the Yelp Duke....excuse me while I try to find a bar that charges $2.50 for a PBR but an extra $1.50 for the can. God, I need help.", 'date': '2017-07-09 16:33:13', 'useful': 10, 'funny': 6, 'cool': 2, 'user': {'review_count': 459, 'average_stars': 3.58, 'yelping_since': '2011-08-20 00:17:08'}}
[R20] {'review_id': 'xYaHcUGp5dhYdL96VjqQJw', 'business_id': '9w6o_eyKCSNKgMtAuv6KWg', 'user_id': 'bLNkaTAlfCbbbrfV-82sSQ', 'stars': 5.0, 'text': "The reason I sought out One Shot Café was because my previous go to coffee spot, La Colombe (Fishtown Location) has severely declined in their quality of service. There have been some changes in their management and in my opinion, it has not been for the better.

I have been an avid fan of La Colombe for about 5-years, well before they achieved the popularity they have now. It used to be a much more inviting environment and the staff was always a pleasure to deal with. In the last 6-months, the overall vibe has changed and customer service is much less friendly. 

It seems to me that employees are unhappy and I actually ran into a person who used to work for La Colombe, and had for quite some time, at Rival Bros Coffee on Spruce Street. I asked why they left and it was for that exact reason. They stopped enjoying it and the work environment became a negative space to be in.

So, here I find myself at One Shot Café for the second day in a row, drinking a perfect Americano and having a bowl of their carrot cake oatmeal, which I had no idea even existed. No worries, it's not just a bowl of sugar, it is nicely balanced and takes a delicious new perspective to oatmeal. 

Customer service wise, everyone that works here is extremely friendly and they love to talk to their customers. Depending on the day, they might be a little slow making your order, NOT because of lack of effort but because they are in the middle of training some new staff so that they can better accommodate the customers they love very much so be patient, it's worth the wait! 

The location itself is saturated with character and a welcoming patina from the counter made of recycled wood, the preserved original ceiling, the charming booths, and yes, they do have plenty of exposed brick so rest easy hipsters of North Philly. 

All in all, the only reason I would go to La Colombe over One Shot Café is to fulfill my craving for their French Toast. Otherwise, One Shot Café is my new and improved go to coffee spot! 

Go follow them on Instagram @ONESHOTCAFE or check out their website at www.1shotcoffee.com

You can follow me @ACARGUY_

## TASK

Analyze rating-text alignment in the reviews.

For each review, determine:
- Positive text: Contains positive sentiment words (amazing, excellent, great, delicious, love, recommend, etc.)
- Negative text: Contains negative sentiment words (terrible, awful, horrible, disappointing, avoid, etc.)
- Aligned: Positive text with 4-5 stars, OR negative text with 1-2 stars
- Misaligned: Positive text with 1-3 stars, OR negative text with 3-5 stars

Note: Reviews with mixed sentiment (both positive and negative words) or neutral sentiment are excluded.

Compute:
1. N_TOTAL: Total reviews
2. N_POSITIVE_TEXT: Reviews with clearly positive sentiment (no negative words)
3. N_NEGATIVE_TEXT: Reviews with clearly negative sentiment (no positive words)
4. N_ALIGNED: Reviews where sentiment matches rating
5. N_MISALIGNED: Reviews where sentiment contradicts rating
6. ALIGNMENT_RATIO: N_ALIGNED / (N_POSITIVE_TEXT + N_NEGATIVE_TEXT) (3 decimal places)
7. AVG_ALIGNED_STARS: Average rating of aligned reviews (0 if none, 2 decimal places)
8. AVG_MISALIGNED_STARS: Average rating of misaligned reviews (0 if none, 2 decimal places)

## OUTPUT FORMAT

After your analysis, output your final answers in EXACTLY this format:

===FINAL ANSWERS===
N_TOTAL: [integer]
N_POSITIVE_TEXT: [integer]
N_NEGATIVE_TEXT: [integer]
N_ALIGNED: [integer]
N_MISALIGNED: [integer]
ALIGNMENT_RATIO: [decimal]
AVG_ALIGNED_STARS: [decimal]
AVG_MISALIGNED_STARS: [decimal]
===END===

Replace each field with your computed value. Do not include units or extra text in the values.

## TASK

Analyze cross-aspect patterns in the reviews.

For each review, identify which aspects are mentioned and their sentiment:
- food: positive (delicious, tasty, fresh) or negative (bland, cold, stale)
- service: positive (friendly, attentive) or negative (rude, slow service, ignored)
- wait: positive (no wait, quick) or negative (long wait, slow, took forever)
- value: positive (great value, worth it) or negative (overpriced, expensive)
- ambiance: positive (cozy, nice atmosphere) or negative (loud, noisy, dirty)

Compute:
1. N_TOTAL: Total reviews
2. N_MULTI_ASPECT: Reviews mentioning 2+ different aspects with sentiment
3. N_FOOD_POSITIVE: Reviews with positive food mentions
4. N_SERVICE_POSITIVE: Reviews with positive service mentions
5. N_WAIT_NEGATIVE: Reviews with negative wait mentions
6. N_COMPENSATION_PATTERN: Reviews with BOTH negative wait AND positive food ("worth the wait")
7. N_SYSTEMIC_NEGATIVE: Reviews with 2+ negative aspects (systemic problem)
8. AVG_MULTI_ASPECT_STARS: Average rating of multi-aspect reviews (0 if none, 2 decimal places)
9. AVG_SINGLE_ASPECT_STARS: Average rating of single-aspect reviews (0 if none, 2 decimal places)

## OUTPUT FORMAT

After your analysis, output your final answers in EXACTLY this format:

===FINAL ANSWERS===
N_TOTAL: [integer]
N_MULTI_ASPECT: [integer]
N_FOOD_POSITIVE: [integer]

N_COMPENSATION_PATTERN: [integer]
N_SYSTEMIC_NEGATIVE: [integer]
AVG_MULTI_ASPECT_STARS: [decimal]
AVG_SINGLE_ASPECT_STARS: [decimal]
===END===

Replace each field with your computed value. Do not include units or extra text in the values.

## TASK

Analyze reviews relative to restaurant expectations.

The restaurant metadata includes price tier and noise level. Evaluate how complaints relate to these attributes.

Compute:
1. N_TOTAL: Total reviews
2. RESTAURANT_PRICE_TIER: The restaurant's price tier from metadata (1-4)
3. RESTAURANT_NOISE_LEVEL: The restaurant's noise level from metadata
4. N_PRICE_COMPLAINTS: Reviews mentioning price issues (expensive, overpriced, pricey, not worth, rip off)
5. N_NOISE_COMPLAINTS: Reviews mentioning noise issues (loud, noisy, couldn't hear)
6. PRICE_COMPLAINT_RATIO: N_PRICE_COMPLAINTS / N_TOTAL (3 decimal places)
7. NOISE_COMPLAINT_RATIO: N_NOISE_COMPLAINTS / N_TOTAL (3 decimal places)
8. AVG_STARS_PRICE_COMPLAINERS: Average rating of reviews with price complaints (0 if none, 2 decimal places)
9. PRICE_ADJUSTED_SCORE: 1 - (PRICE_COMPLAINT_RATIO * (5 - PRICE_TIER)) (3 decimal places)

## OUTPUT FORMAT

After your analysis, output your final answers in EXACTLY this format:

N_TOTAL: [integer]

All of the food I've had is good here--the sushi is very fresh and the sandwiches are all made to order. Definitely try the SQ Melt--it's a loaded three-cheese grilled cheese with tomato, avocado, and bacon. Plus it's only $6.75, which is a low price for an Old City sandwich.

Free Wifi is an added bonus, and there is a surprisingly large amount of seating for such a small place. However, the bathroom is out of order indefinitely, so you won't be able to sit here and drink coffee all day.

My biggest complaint is that the menu in store is a little confusing--the sandwiches are listed with their base price, which is good, but some of the extra ingredients (like a fried egg on the Baconator) is misleadingly listed as being part of the sandwich, when one actually has to ask to add it on, for an extra price. ## TASK

Analyze the relationship between wait times and customer satisfaction.

Compute:
1. N_REVIEWS_WITH_WAIT: Count of reviews mentioning 'wait', 'line', 'queue', 'table', 'reservation'.
2. N_WORTH_IT: From wait group, count explicitly positive wait experiences ("worth it", "moved fast").
3. N_NOT_WORTH_IT: From wait group, count negative wait experiences ("too long", "slow").
4. WAIT_REDEEMABILITY_RATIO: N_WORTH_IT / N_REVIEWS_WITH_WAIT (3 decimal places).
5. MOST_COMMON_WAIT_COMPLAINT: Most frequent complaint keyword in negative wait reviews (e.g. 'too long', 'slow').

## OUTPUT FORMAT

After your analysis, output your final answers in EXACTLY this format:

===FINAL ANSWERS===
N_REVIEWS_WITH_WAIT: [integer]
N_WORTH_IT: [integer]
N_NOT_WORTH_IT: [integer]
WAIT_REDEEMABILITY_RATIO: [decimal]
MOST_COMMON_WAIT_COMPLAINT: [string]
===END===

Replace each field with your computed value. Do not include units or extra text in the values.

[R20] {'review_id': 'QxdmraXhOBVVC4HJvwtouQ', 'business_id': 'AWJyivVwe3t9BO-k8D0ynQ', 'user_id': 'Am_G2m0pwVrEg9AoUp5tow', 'stars': 3.0, 'text': "I've been looking for an all-purpose eatery for a while, and I think I've found it in Cafe Square One. Salads, sandwiches, and even sushi are available, plus a few snacks and pastries. La Colombe coffee and smoothies are served, too.

All of the food I've had is good here--the sushi is very fresh and the sandwiches are all made to order. Definitely try the SQ Melt--it's a loaded three-cheese grilled cheese with tomato, avocado, and bacon. Plus it's only $6.75, which is a low price for an Old City sandwich.

Free Wifi is an added bonus, and there is a surprisingly large amount of seating for such a small place. However, the bathroom is out of order indefinitely, so you won't be able to sit here and drink coffee all day.

My biggest complaint is that the menu in store is a little confusing--the sandwiches are listed with their base price, which is good, but some of the extra ingredients (like a fried egg on the Baconator) is misleadingly listed as being part of the sandwich, when one actually has to ask to add it on, for an extra price.
